column2: As we progress on this journey, we need to a Global Service Transition practice manager who will report to the Global Service Strategy & Design lead, providing best-practice guidance for the service transition stage of the service management lifecycle across WPP IT. This is a senior role, and we are looking for an experienced ITIL certified Service Transition Lead to work in WPP IT Service Management. You will manage the Global Service transition practice and be responsible for coordination of transition assurance for WPP IT's pipeline of strategic initiatives.     As well as being hands on, you will be managing a team who ensure that the requirements developed in service design are effectively realized in live operation while controlling the risks of failure and subsequent disruption. You will also need to assure service retirement and transfer of services between service providers.       What you'll be doing:         Managing and developing the Service Transition team with high performance and excellence in mind.     Developing and improving capabilities for transitioning new and changed services into supported environments, building, acceptance into service, validation testing, evaluation and deployment.     Working closely with peers, Projects and Programmes, support and coordinate initiatives through the ITSM lifecycle.     Managing risks relating to new, changed or retired services allowing for innovation while minimizing the unintended consequences of change.     Introducing new services and successfully deploying service releases into supported environments.     Decommissioning and discontinuation of services, infrastructure components and applications.     You will be responsible for driving continual service improvement across all aspects of Service Transition.     You will be responsible for maturing service transition processes in support of the ITSM lifecycle and clearly defining the interfaces (integration) between these processes and other processes outside of service transition.            What you'll need:         Strong Customer Service Management experience and skills.     Service Transition and/or ITIL Lifecycle Continual Service Improvement.     Six Sigma experience desirable.     Agile experience in a CLOUD environment.     Relevant Continual Service Improvement (CSI) experience.     Strong Change, Release and Service Asset & Configuration Management experience     Strong Supplier and Stakeholder management skills     Strong communication, influencing and analytical skills     Working knowledge and understanding of Service Delivery as a whole.     Proven leadership and people skills in a global setting.     Good technology insight with a full appreciation of how technology can enable positive business change            Who you are:         You're open :    We are inclusive and collaborative; we encourage the free exchange of ideas; we respect and celebrate diverse views. We are accepting: of new ideas, new partnerships, new ways of working.       You're optimistic :    We believe in the power of creativity, technology and talent to create brighter futures or our people, our clients and our communities. We approach all that we do with conviction: to try the new and to seek the unexpected.       You're extraordinary:    we are stronger together: through collaboration we achieve the amazing. We are creative leaders and pioneers of our industry; we provide extraordinary every day.       What we'll give you:         Passionate, inspired people    - We promote a culture of people that do extraordinary work.       Scale and opportunity    - We offer the opportunity to create, influence and complete projects at a scale that is unparalleled in the industry.       Challenging and stimulating work    - Unique work and the opportunity to join a group of creative problem solvers. Are you up for the challenge?       ?
column11: Automation, Assurance, Bloomberg, Stock exchange, Configuration management, Diversity and Inclusion, Agile, Manager Technology, Stakeholder management, Six sigma

column2: This role is within the GBS People Services Quality and Performance     The teams core responsibility is on process system performance and data quality related to People Function     This role will require frequent interaction with stakeholders to communicate testing progress, risks, and quality metrics and play a crucial role in identifying areas for improvement in the testing process and implementing changes to enhance efficiency and effectiveness             What you will do:         Discuss with process managers and other stakeholders on testing priorities, resource allocation, and any changes or updates to the testing approach.     Holding team meetings to discuss progress, issues, and priorities while assigning tasks and responsibilities to team members.     Providing guidance, support, and feedback to testers.     Addressing any challenges or conflicts within the team.     Review test plans, test cases, and test scripts to ensure they meet quality standards and effectively cover the required functionality.     Analyzing test results and identifying defects or areas for improvement.     Collaborating with development teams to prioritize and address issues found during testing.     Providing updates on testing progress, quality metrics, and risk assessments to project managers, senior leadership, and other stakeholders.     Addressing questions, concerns, or feedback from stakeholders regarding testing activities or quality assurance processes.     Evaluating current testing practices and identifying areas for improvement or optimization.     Providing training or mentoring to testers to improve their skills and capabilities.           The skills you bring:         Min. 5 years of experience as Test Lead/Manager specialized in UAT for various software projects.     Should have a strong understanding of the software development lifecycle (SDLC) and testing processes.     Strong decision-making and problem-solving skills.     Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate with stakeholders at all levels.     Strong collaboration skills, including the ability to work closely with cross-functional teams such as Delivery, Process Management, development, product management, and quality assurance.     Ability to think critically and strategically to devise effective testing strategies and solutions.     Deep understanding of quality assurance principles and practices     Familiarity with continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines.     Knowledge of test automation frameworks and tools, with the ability to automate repetitive testing tasks.     Proactive attitude towards self-improvement and professional development.
column11: Product management, Manager Quality Assurance, Test scripts, Resource allocation, Software development life cycle, Data quality, Test cases, SDLC, Process management, Testing

column2: Lead and manage the day-to-day operations of the DPW SOC, ensuring the timely and effective detection, analysis, and response to security incidents.         Develop and enforce standard operating procedures (SOPs) to streamline SOC processes and workflows.         Monitor SOC performance metrics and key performance indicators (KPIs) to ensure operational efficiency and effectiveness. Track and monitor SLAs (Service Level Agreements) related to incident response and resolution, ensuring compliance and timely escalation as needed.         Serve as the primary point of contact for internal and external stakeholders, including executive leadership, IT teams, legal, internal/external audit and external partners.         Communicate SOC initiatives, priorities, and achievements to stakeholders, and address their concerns or feedback as needed.         Develop and maintain SOC staffing schedules, ensuring adequate coverage for 24/7 monitoring and response operations. Manage SOC analyst shifts and rotations, balancing workload distribution and ensuring adherence to established schedules.         Design and implement SOC dashboards and reporting mechanisms to track key metrics, including incident volumes, response times, and SLA compliance.         Prepare and deliver regular reports on SOC performance, incident trends, and security posture to senior management and stakeholders.         Utilize data analytics and visualization tools to identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement within SOC operations.         Drive innovation within the SOC by identifying opportunities for process automation, tool enhancement, and workflow optimization.         Support improve centre-of-excellence for IT security governance in DP World.             OTHER             Act as an ambassador for DP World at all times when working; promoting and demonstrating positive behaviours in harmony with DP World s Founder s Principles, values and culture; ensuring the highest level of safety is applied in all activities; understanding and following DP World s Code of Conduct and Ethics policies.         Perform other related duties as assigned.             QUALIFICATIONS, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS             Knowledge and Experience             Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field. Advanced degree or relevant certifications (e.g., CISSP, CISM, GCIH) preferred.         10+ years of proven experience managing a SOC or similar cybersecurity operations environment.         Strong understanding of cybersecurity principles, incident response methodologies, and threat detection techniques.         Proficiency in data analysis, report writing, and dashboard development.             Soft Skills             Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.         Ability to multitask, prioritize tasks, and work effectively under pressure in a fast-paced environment.         Excellent analytical skills.         Program and Project management skills.         Time management skills.         Team player and conflict management skills.         Ability to adapt in a complex environment, loves challenges, with the will and drive to learn new things on his/her own.         Cultural awareness.                 Technical Skills             Proficiency in incident response methodologies and procedures.         Knowledge of threat intelligence sources and integration into SOC operations.         Experience in leading and coordinating incident response efforts.

column2: Aster Medcity is looking for Senior Associate - Revenue Cycle Management to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     As a Senior Associate in Revenue Cycle Management, you will be responsible for ensuring the efficient and effective functioning of the revenue cycle processes within a healthcare organization     You will oversee various aspects of revenue cycle operations, including patient registration, charge capture, coding, billing, claims processing, denial management, and accounts receivable follow-up     Your primary goal will be to optimize revenue generation, maximize collections, and minimize denials to ensure the financial health of the organization     Responsibilities:Revenue Cycle Oversight:Manage and supervise the revenue cycle operations, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements and industry best practices     Develop and implement strategies to optimize revenue generation and enhance cash flow     Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and financial metrics to identify trends, areas for improvement, and potential revenue leakage     Collaborate with cross-functional teams, such as clinical departments, finance, coding, and compliance, to streamline revenue cycle processes     Billing and Claims Management:Oversee the timely and accurate submission of claims to third-party payers, including Medicare, Medicaid, commercial insurance companies, and self-pay patients     Monitor claim status and work closely with the billing team to resolve any coding or billing discrepancies     Analyze denial patterns, identify root causes, and implement corrective measures to minimize denials and maximize collections     Stay updated with changes in healthcare regulations, payer policies, and coding guidelines to ensure compliance and accurate billing     Accounts Receivable Management:Review and analyze accounts receivable aging reports to identify delinquent accounts and take appropriate actions for timely payment     Implement strategies for effective accounts receivable follow-up, including phone calls, appeals, and negotiations with payers and patients     Collaborate with the finance team to reconcile payments, identify posting errors, and resolve outstanding balances     Provide guidance and support to the team in resolving complex billing and reimbursement issues     Process Improvement:Continuously assess revenue cycle processes, identify inefficiencies, and recommend process improvements to enhance operational efficiency and revenue integrity     Implement automation and technology solutions to streamline workflows and reduce manual intervention     Conduct regular audits and reviews to ensure compliance with coding guidelines, billing regulations, and internal policies     Develop and deliver training programs to educate staff on revenue cycle best practices, coding updates, and compliance requirements     Qualifications:Bachelors degree in Healthcare Administration, Business Administration, or a related field (master's degree preferred)     Experience in revenue cycle management or healthcare finance     Strong knowledge of healthcare reimbursement systems, billing regulations, and coding guidelines (e g, CPT, ICD-10, HCPCS)     Proficiency in using revenue cycle management software and electronic health record (EHR) systems     Familiarity with third-party payer requirements, including Medicare, Medicaid, and commercial insurance     Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret financial data and identify trends     Strong leadership and team management abilities     Effective communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with various stakeholders     Certified Professional Biller (CPB) or Certified Revenue Cycle Specialist (CRCS) certification is a plus     Note: The above job description is a general outline and may vary depending on the organization and its specific requirements
column11: Automation, Team management, Claims, Coding, Process improvement, Analytical, Billing, Healthcare, Revenue cycle management, Operations

column2: Working closely with diverse stakeholders, you will deliver a product that exceeds expectations and drives innovation. You will be empowered to influence and drive key decisions and with your leadership skills, navigate the complex Eurofins network. We are looking for leaders who will uphold the high-performance culture at Eurofins and as a senior manager, you will interface with the business and lead teams of developers, testers, scrum masters, and managers who will look up to you for support and guidance every day.         This role reports to Director (IT Solutions) and involves international travel (10%)             ?       Primary Responsibilities   :     In this role as Sr Engineering Manager, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining a eCommerce solution from concept to delivery, building and working with a high performing team in the process and also oversee the sunset of existing platform. The individual will be part of leadership team and collaborate with geographically distributed teams, including developer, DevOps, Cloud engineers, support.             ?       Specific Assignments:         Responsible for hiring, coaching and mentoring a high performing team.     Provides strategic consultation to Business and IT leadership, recommendations and manages the entire project life-cycle phases.     Defines priorities, elaborates roadmaps, and ensures that project deliverables are in line with the business requirements, delivered on schedule, and meeting the quality standards defined.     Responsible for performance appraisal of the team members with regular 1-1 and providing constructive feedback to build individual competency and growth.     Collaborate with other leaders to drive a culture of learning and elevating team maturity.     Apply strong engineering principles to drive the best development practices.     Technically hands-on and support and guide the team members in Design reviews and driving the best engineering practices.     Be an evangelist of agility and ensure the development teams are practicing the core agile principles and values.     Develop and Deliver high quality shippable product as per the scope of the program working with internal and external stakeholders.     Report to Project Steering Committee as per the schedule. This includes both functional reports to the Program Director and Project status reports for senior management review.     Support Organization goal of adopting tenets of high performing organization and other initiatives in the journey to be Great place to work.             Skills required:         Extensive experience in working with people and stakeholders across geographies.     Extensive experience in developing e-commerce solutions and applications in Microsoft technologies     Strong experience with enterprise architecture and development practices     Strong experience in an Agile development environment and tools     Strong orientation towards data driven insights.     Experience in Automation and Performance engineering     Experience working with stakeholders, preferably with US and Europe     Passionate about software development with very good communication skills             Preferred Qualifications:         Bachelors or Masters in Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent.     Minimum 15 years of experience in IT Application/Software development with atleast 5 years in leadership role     Experience of at least 1 enterprise eCommerce application from concept to delivery     Working experience with Product development organizations of Pedigree              Tech Stack:         Angular 12 and above, .NET Core, Azure Cloud, CMS experience (Umbraco, Sitecore..), SQL Server, Development tools, Excel, Azure DevOps, UI/UX tools

column2: As a Senior Associate in Revenue Cycle Management, you will be responsible for ensuring the efficient and effective functioning of the revenue cycle processes within a healthcare organization     You will oversee various aspects of revenue cycle operations, including patient registration, charge capture, coding, billing, claims processing, denial management, and accounts receivable follow-up     Your primary goal will be to optimize revenue generation, maximize collections, and minimize denials to ensure the financial health of the organization         Responsibilities:         Revenue Cycle Oversight:Manage and supervise the revenue cycle operations, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements and industry best practices     Develop and implement strategies to optimize revenue generation and enhance cash flow     Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and financial metrics to identify trends, areas for improvement, and potential revenue leakage     Collaborate with cross-functional teams, such as clinical departments, finance, coding, and compliance, to streamline revenue cycle processes     Billing and Claims Management:Oversee the timely and accurate submission of claims to third-party payers, including Medicare, Medicaid, commercial insurance companies, and self-pay patients     Monitor claim status and work closely with the billing team to resolve any coding or billing discrepancies     Analyze denial patterns, identify root causes, and implement corrective measures to minimize denials and maximize collections     Stay updated with changes in healthcare regulations, payer policies, and coding guidelines to ensure compliance and accurate billing     Accounts Receivable Management:Review and analyze accounts receivable aging reports to identify delinquent accounts and take appropriate actions for timely payment     Implement strategies for effective accounts receivable follow-up, including phone calls, appeals, and negotiations with payers and patients     Collaborate with the finance team to reconcile payments, identify posting errors, and resolve outstanding balances     Provide guidance and support to the team in resolving complex billing and reimbursement issues     Process Improvement:Continuously assess revenue cycle processes, identify inefficiencies, and recommend process improvements to enhance operational efficiency and revenue integrity     Implement automation and technology solutions to streamline workflows and reduce manual intervention     Conduct regular audits and reviews to ensure compliance with coding guidelines, billing regulations, and internal policies     Develop and deliver training programs to educate staff on revenue cycle best practices, coding updates, and compliance requirements         Qualifications:         Bachelors degree in Healthcare Administration, Business Administration, or a related field (master's degree preferred)     Experience in revenue cycle management or healthcare finance     Strong knowledge of healthcare reimbursement systems, billing regulations, and coding guidelines (eg, CPT, ICD-10, HCPCS)     Proficiency in using revenue cycle management software and electronic health record (EHR) systems     Familiarity with third-party payer requirements, including Medicare, Medicaid, and commercial insurance     Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret financial data and identify trends     Strong leadership and team management abilities     Effective communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with various stakeholders     Certified Professional Biller (CPB) or Certified Revenue Cycle Specialist (CRCS) certification is a plus     Note: The above job description is a general outline and may vary depending on the organization and its specific requirements
column11: Automation, Team management, Claims, Coding, Process improvement, Analytical, Billing, Healthcare, Revenue cycle management, Operations

column2: Personnel performance, evaluations, priorities, training, certifications, scheduling, retention, and new hires.      Complete, and periodically maintain, proper departmental documention, such as but not limited to:      troubleshooting guides,      policies,      procedures,      processes,      resolution guides,      walkthroughs,      training material.      Ensuring documented departmental policies, procedures, processes, etc. are followed.      Apply strong triage methodologies for proper and timely creation, handing, resolution, management, communication, and closure throughout a Tier 2 trouble ticket life cycle.      Develop and maintain departmental and individual key performance indicators, per ticket-type SLOs, communication internal and content requirements, escalation SLAs, and reports that track key metrics associated to each.      Continually identify, define, and lead initiatives that improve the customer experience, reduce ticket duration, eliminate ticket creations, avoid repetitive tasks, and/or streamline ticket handling.      Maintain actual and forecasted personnel work demand calculators, with augments and training being completed prior to resource exhaustion.      Improve existing tools, data, and content utilized or provided by Tier 2 to customers, agents, and other AireSpring departments.      Act as the primary escalation point of contact for issues raised beyond technician and supervisors levels, and own a timely path to resolution and communication related to the escalation.      Implement and maintain a robust root cause data gathering method for all tickets and escalations, and seek to eliminate/reduce go-forward similar tickets and escalations through inter-departmental process/data improvement initiatives, customer/agent education, personnel training, documentation improvements, tool changes/development, and automation projects.      Set departmental standards, develop and maintain a robust quality assurance system, and manage the results to the standards.      Ensure that the Tier 2 globally distributed technical support departments operate successfully 24x7 and that escalations and ticket management are performed by skilled and available resources during each shift.        Position Requirements:        5+ years of experience as a technical trouble ticket manager or supervisor, with 15+ reports, at a large 24x7 MSP/ISP that offers Internet, networking, security, HPBX, SD-WAN, and SIP services via a multitude of carriers and circuit types (mobile wireless, satellite, fixed wireless, DoCSIS, DSL, TDM, and fiber/copper Ethernet).      3+ years of experience as a senior NOC or repair technician that individually resolved Internet, networking, security, HPBX, SD-WAN, and SIP services.      Deep demonstrable understanding of the OSI layers and troubleshooting techniques across them for all applications/services.      Strong educator/mentoring skills to provide escalation-level assistance and support to technicians and supervisors that may require guidance on open tickets.      Hands-on experience and technical certifications with Fortinet FW/SD-WAN/Wi-Fi/switches, Velo/VMware/Broadsoft SD-WAN, Cisco Meraki routers/switches/Wi-Fi, PEPlink and/or BEC mobile wireless routers and modems, the Cisco Broadsoft/Webex or Microsoft Metaswitch HPBX platforms, and finally CLI-based BGP/OSPF/VLANs/AAA/security routing and switching on Cisco, Adtran, and Fortinet devices.      5 years of experience with monitoring platforms, as well as functional development, tool development, and automation related to those platforms.      Deep understanding of how SNMP, ICMP, scripts, API, closed portals, vendor OSS/BSS platforms, Syslog, RADIUS logs, SNMP alerts, and TACACS logs can be leveraged to improve the customer experience, and improve Tier 2 event awareness and performance.      Proven ability to source and hire highly skilled technicians from any location across the planet, integrate them into a technical support infrastructure, and manage their performance.      Demonstrable history, focus, and mastery of responsibilities outlined above
column11: VMware, Automation, Manager Quality Assurance, Bss, WAN, Ethernet, SNMP, microsoft, Troubleshooting, Technical support

column2: As a ServiceNow Service Development Manager, you will be responsible for selling a portfolio of service offerings designed to help our customers successfully adopt the products they have purchased and ultimately achieve the business outcomes they expected from utilising our products     These service offerings include our Impact success offering and product adoption services     The SDM is integral to the regional sales team     They collaborate with the Services Account Executive, account team and our customers to ensure successful implementation and adoption     In a quota-carrying role, the Services Development Manager partners with the Services Account Executive, the ServiceNow Sales team and our partner ecosystem to develop and successfully execute Services sales opportunities across the territories of the Services Account Executive on very large accounts and new logos             Collaborate with inside and outside Digital, Field, and Partner sales team members to develop and execute success and adoption services opportunities in collaboration with the Services Account Executives and their designated territories.     Work with the SAE in your region to prioritise sales activities against specific opportunities on clear role-responsible guidelines.     Work effectively and collaborate with the Expert Services delivery team to identify additional revenue opportunities from existing engagements, including Change Orders.     Participate in all district activities to develop a programmatic approach to creating, managing, and closing a pipeline of opportunities commensurate with achieving assigned service quotas.     Proactively create new Services opportunities Impact and Adoption Services for new and installed base customers.     Own the responsibility for any Impact Guided deal in the territories of the Services Account Executives.     Manage sales opportunities and business relationships from the office with influential contacts across the territories of the Services Account Executive on very large accounts and new logos. Work with the extended support and delivery team to drive the development of packaging strategies and services proposals.     Prioritise and manage inbound services sales requests.     Execute Value-based Selling Methodology for Impact and Adoption services opportunities.     Meeting or exceeding Monthly, Quarterly and Annual sales targets.     Providing accurate information to management for forecasting, quarterly business reviews, etc.     Ensuring compliance with operational standards and customer relationship management.         To be successful in this role, you have to:         Profound relationship-building skills and senior communication skills.     Strong understanding of sales and decision processes in large organisations.     Demonstrated experience in enterprise software or consulting services.     Proven track record of accurate forecasting and achieving quota.     Strong technical aptitude to understand the desired business outcomes and translate those to services capabilities that ServiceNow can deliver.     Experience selling enterprise-class solutions, services, or success in person or remotely via Zoom.     A thorough understanding of the sales process and the ability to navigate and progress short but complex sales cycles.     Sales force automation, enterprise resource planning, or other IT infrastructure management monitoring and discovery technologies are definite pluses.     Presentation skills via web-based tools.     Persistent, dependable, and accountable.     Skilled at concisely summarising salient points in the English language.     Strong collaboration skills to drive business while working side-by-side with the Services Sales Executive.     ?

column2: As a Technology Manager you will be responsible for end to end delivery, process, quality under your area of influence. As a group head, you will utilize communication, interpersonal, technical and organizational skills to remove obstacles, enhance collaboration, and ensure teams are able to deliver results.                     Essential Duties and Responsibilities:                   Facilitate and organize resource ramp-up and knowledge transition for the set of projects(s) to ensure sound business continuity                 Prevent or remove impediments and distractions that interfere with the ability of the development team to deliver on their goals                 Work with all the stake holders which include but not limited to Product management, support team, Infrastructure, performance, Enterprise Architect, Senior Management teams to ensure planned release to market on time with desired quality. column2: As a Manager of CloudOps, you will have the opportunity join a team of engineers that are developing a new cloud-native platform to deliver value added SAS Services via self-service automation to SAS internal and external customers. You will help guide the architecture and implement complex orchestration across global cloud providers. A strong aptitude for continuous learning and rapidly implementing modern technologies is required. Additionally, this role requires a holistic view of managing skilled development teams, architecture, applied development, operations, performance, security, and costs on modern cloud providers.                        You will   :               Manage a team of engineers and developers to build and operate the SAS CloudOps platform architecture, components, and APIs.         Take ownership of projects with minimal guidance.         Be responsible for building and maintaining business partnerships including collaboration around expectations and deliverables for IT technology efforts.           Be responsible for ensuring prioritized technology efforts are staffed and executed using the appropriate methodologies and standards. Effectively identifies, manages, mitigates and escalates risk to all levels of management.           Keep group members informed, manages administrative aspects of the department including personnel matters. Sets performance goals/standards/objectives for the team. Performs all management responsibilities for the team including coaching and fostering growth and development.           Optimize workflows for cloud native developed solutions for performance and cost efficiency.                 What we are looking for:                     Required:             Management and leadership skills.           Strong knowledge of Cloud service providers such as Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud Provider.           Working knowledge of a variety of IT concepts and trends, best practices, procedures, security, integration and quality assurance techniques.           Strong knowledge of Software Development Lifecycle methods and standards.           Strong ability to manage multiple, parallel work efforts; effectively manage competing priorities and mitigate obstacles.           Ability to build a high-performance team through staff forecasting, interviewing, hiring, performance evaluations, disciplinary action and coaching, mentoring, training, inspiring and motivating employees.           Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal skills.             The nice to haves:             Previous people management experience.         Experience with emerging technologies such as Kubernetes and Open Source technologies.         Experience developing cloud native solutions on AWS, Azure or GCP         Proficiency with application development.             Education and Experience:             Bachelors degree in Computer Science or some other related field.         Five or more years of relevant experience in an enterprise              Equivalency:             Equivalent combination of education, training, and relevant experience may be considered in place of the requirements stated above.         The level of this position will be determined based on the applicants education, skills and experience.

column2: The purpose of this role is to act as Champion, Owner, and Custodian of the Global HR Process and Systems from a Learning and Development perspective. As Process and Systems Lead you will be responsible for the system process design and integrity and ensure that the processes and systems are accessible, easy to operate, and efficient.                  ?         Key Responsibilities:               Partner with the Process and Value Lead to initiate change requests, and in conjunction with the Tech Product Owners, assess those changes and determine feasibility and contribute input to business benefit      Develop and present system changes to the relevant governance bodies for review and approval, in particular at Small/Big Room Planning (capital allocation processes)      Cooperate with Business SMEs to feed in requirements to the appropriate Agile teams, and provide prioritisation for Process/Systems SMEs      Ensure that the systems remain compliant with legal and fiscal or regulatory requirements across countries      Continually seek to standardise and simplify the system to reduce ongoing business and implementation costs      Manage all system upgrades relates to learning and development, deciding what new functionality to implement and leads the change in partnership with the POE CoE      Review deviations in business processes and work with wider HR to understand the validity of the deviations.      Cooperate with Tech Product Owners to understand new technology opportunities in the marketplace and assess if and how they will improve GSK s processes.     Benchmark against peers to validate GSK s pace of technological advancement and understand how other organizations are gaining cost and efficiencies through tech.                    Why you                     ?         Necessary skills:               A Masters degree or extensive up to date experience in the learning and development space     Experience of 10 -15 years working in HR or Tech environment in the Learning and Development space (Significant experience as an SME/Practitioner in similar role)     Proven experience in process mapping and senior relationship and stakeholder management.     Experience in system process design, assess and articulate business requirements     Knowledge of Agile Ways of Working and Scrum/Kanban Delivery     Understanding of best practices of Learning and Development solutions within the HR space     Sound understanding of process simplification and standardization and experience in global process and systems roll-outs     Strong understanding of the technology, digital advancements, and data landscapes, particularly in relation to the impact of GenAI and Skills on the learning and development domain.                    Preferred Qualifications Skills:               Experience working in a highly complex organization within a matrixed structure, leveraging influence within a complex network of stakeholders.     Excellent communication skills and the ability to work flexibly within a matrix team     Large scale business transformation experience in a global company     Experience working on Service Now, Workday, Success Factors, Experience platforms, JIRA and GenAI solutions delivery.               Why GSK               Career at one of the leading global healthcare companies     Contract of employment     Hybrid working model     Attractive reward package (annual bonus awards for outstanding performance, recognition awards for additional achievements and engagement, holiday benefit)     Life insurance and pension plan     Private medical package with additional preventive healthcare services for employees and their eligible counterparts     Sports cards (Multisport)     Possibilities of development within the role and company s structure     Personalized learning approach (mentoring, online training platforms: Pluralsight, Business Skills, Harvard Manage Mentor, Skillsoft and external training)     Extensive support of work life balance (flexible working solutions, short Fridays option, health well-being activities)     Supportive community and integration events     Modern office with creative rooms, fresh fruits everyday     Free car and bike parking, locker rooms and showers
column11: Procurement, Process design, Business transformation, Development Manager, Agile, Manager Technology, Healthcare, Scrum, HR, Stakeholder management

column2: A career within SAP Consulting services, will provide you with the opportunity to help our clients maximise the value of their SAP investment with offerings that address sales, finance, supply chain, engineering, and human capital     We provide comprehensive consulting, system integration and implementation services across multiple SAP applications, products and technologies     Simply put, we focus on delivering business led, technology enabled change for our clients including industry specific enterprise resource planning and the latest in mobile, analytics and cloud solutions             We are looking for an SAP Fiori consultant with at least 8 years of SAP experience in 3-5 implementation projects and a few upgrade/migration/support projects in S4HANA/BTP environment.      The candidate will work closely with business team in understanding the requirement and work with functional teams to design and implement the UI solution.      The candidate should be able to work independently and to   extend needed technical support to the team.     Strong understanding of SAP UI5 / Fiori architecture, data models, elements, and deployment options.     Having working knowledge and experience on BTP will be an added advantage.     Very good hands on experience in SAP tools like Business Application Studio (BAS), Fiori elements and working experience on GitHub.     Should have sound architectural knowledge in both SAP Fiori Custom Mobility solutions for on premise and cloud platforms to participate in proposing application designs and landscape setup.     Experience in taking the responsibility of end-to-end ownership from Design to Support.     Strong knowledge on Fiori Implementations Extensions with deep understanding of UI5 libraries.     Strong experience with SAPUI5 and/or HTML5 or other Front-end Web Application development frameworks.     Experience in Odata, Gateway service development, SAP Objects would be an added advantage.     Experience in designing and implementing scalable solutions in a large-scale distributed environment.     Support the team in delivery to ensure adherence to quality and scheduling goals.            Partner with business stakeholders to ensure delivered solutions are fit for use and purpose while maintaining high levels of customer satisfaction.     Identify, Improve and optimize opportunities to improve product deployment processes.     Experience in Solution Manager / Focus Build for change management.     Should be able to perform code quality review, performance tuning and debugging to ensure the quality and easy maintenance of development objects.     Excellent Communicational, Interpersonal and Presentation skills.     Lead a team of 5+ members if more than 6 years of experience.       Qualification:    bachelors degree in engineering or Master of Computer Application.   Having an SAP Technical Certification is preferred               Mandatory skill sets- SAP FIORI/UI5. BTP, S4HANA    Qualifications -     B.E. / B.Tech / MCA/ M.E/ M.TECH/ MBA/ PGDM. All qualifications should be in regular full-time mode with no extension of course duration due to backlogs

column1: Package Consultant: Oracle Enterprise Performance Management
column2: A career in IBM Consulting is rooted by long-term relationships and close collaboration with clients across the globe. You'll work with visionaries across multiple industries to improve the hybrid cloud and AI journey for the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Your ability to accelerate impact and make meaningful change for your clients is enabled by our strategic partner ecosystem and our robust technology platforms across the IBM portfolio; including Software and Red Hat. Curiosity and a constant quest for knowledge serve as the foundation to success in IBM Consulting. In your role, you'll be encouraged to challenge the norm, investigate ideas outside of your role, and come up with creative solutions resulting in ground breaking impact for a wide network of clients. Our culture of evolution and empathy centers on long-term career growth and development opportunities in an environment that embraces your unique skills and experience. Your Role and Responsibilities Develop partnerships with key stake holders in Finance to understand the strategic direction, business process, and business needs Should be well versed with AGILE Scrum Devops. Create technical solutions to meet business requirements Help Finance business users adopt best practices Excellent Verbal & written communication skills. Implement plans to test business and functional processes Lead technical acceptance testing (Unit, SIT, and QAT) of patches and upgrades Deliver training content to users. Candidate must be ready to work from office daily and in shifts if required. NO Work From Home allowed.  Required Technical and Professional Expertise Implementation Certified in Hyperion HFM version 11.1.2.4/FCCS. Strong experience in writing and maintain clear, concise functional and technical specifications on HFM applications and business system processes.  5+ years of experience working with HFM and FDMEE.Strong experience in developing and maintaining FDMEE mappings, validation rules and new integration set up. Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise Sound functional knowledge of financial process like Income Statement, Balance Sheet and Cash flow. Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment. Proficient on all components of HFM like Metadata setup, Ownership Management, Rules, Journals, Currency translation, Consolidation, and data integration with downstream systems.
column11: validation rules, devops, scrum, troubleshooting, agile, oracle, epm, firebird, hyperion essbase, oracle data guard, hfm, sql server, hyperion, oracle database 9i, hyperion planning, mysql, cash flow, performance management, oracle enterprise performance management

column2: This is a hands-on Workday development and leadership position with direct reports.      Exceptional communication, problem solving and curiosity are strongly required.        Hand-on Workday experience preferred. Certifications are nice but not as important as real world experience.                What You ll do on a Typical Day        :-            Lead Workday specific integration development team, including leading remote global resources using Workday Studio and other supporting technologies.          Provide hands-on Workday programming expertise and leadership as part of a Workday Integrations team which is expected to develop, monitor, support and enhance about 120 integrations with plans to grow. We currently have three full time junior and senior Workday developers under this position and we expect to grow this year.          Understand and take ownership for the end-to-end data flow for assigned integrations (from Workday to 3rd parties and vice-versa), including performing hands-on Workday configuration and code updates as necessary so that integrations running across multiple technologies deliver the required business outcomes.          Ensure GBT s approximately 30 global payroll integrations are developed according to Workday best practices, minimize ongoing maintenance needs, and run      efficiently/effectively      with the end result of paying all GBT employees correctly          Develop, build, test and deploy new integrations leveraging leading-edge technologies to facilitate good business outcomes and position GBT to meet future requirements          Understand and provide input on integrating Workday into the larger Enterprise Architecture for the organization (SSO, IP whitelisting, toolset changes)        Works closely with the lead Extend developer to improve Workday via Extend applications        Manage and lead Jira-based Agile Integration development cycle that focuses on accuracy and integrity of data and applications through analysis, coding, clear documentation and problem resolution          Design and develop interfaces and conduct unit and integration tests          Perform integration regression testing          Understand data governance and security including solid SOX audit compliance                  What We re looking for        :-            Very strong Workday Studio development experience. You will need to be able to demonstrate this experience.          Excellent verbal and written communication skills are absolutely vital. This position works daily with multiple teams around the world. You will participate in calls on many levels and you will host and present calls as well.          Specific Workday to ADP integration experience preferred          Experience with one or more full-life cycle implementations of Workday preferred          Demonstrated experience with Workday development tool sets required:    Enterprise Interface Builder (EIB), Workday Studio, Workday Report Writer, Studio BIRT Module, RAAS, PECI, etc.). Some familiarity with Extend is helpful.          Strong technical experience with XSLT, XTT, XML and object-oriented development including Java.          Experience with APIs and Web Services standards (WSDL, SOAP, REST).          Experience integrating Workday Time & Absence to 3rd party systems is helpful        Experience managing the integration testing of Workday releases is helpful        Ability to work and coordinate with third parties on integration related inquiries including testing and communications          Bachelor s Degree in relevant technical field (Information Technology, Computer Science, Software, Engineering or related technical discipline) or equivalent combination of training and work experience          Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment and to adapt to frequent change while maintaining focused calm in the face of challenges. And a sense of humor is nice.

column2: As a Practice Manager in Data Engineering, you will play a pivotal role in growing Lagozon s Data Engineering business by identifying and leveraging opportunities to enhance business outcomes through innovative data solutions. This role demands a strong technology leader with a deep understanding of data engineering technologies and practices, including hands-on experience with leading platforms like Databricks and Snowflake, and a solid grasp of the Azure Databricks platform for scalable data analytics solutions.       Responsibilities         At least 10 years of overall experience, with a minimum of 5 years in hands-on development of Data Warehouse and Data Lake solutions.         Strong experience with data programming languages (e.g., Python, Scala) and data warehouses (e.g., Snowflake, Databricks).         Essential experience in Azure and Databricks.         Proven experience as a delivery lead in building data engineering capabilities and services.         Certifications in Azure Databricks, Apache Spark, or related data engineering technologies will be an added advantage.           Qualifications         1. Technical Leadership: Provide hands-on implementation expertise with Databricks/ Snowflake Data Platforms to design and support scalable data analytics solutions.   2. Solution Architecture: Architect, design, and deliver data analytics solutions that align with business goals and are scalable, performance-oriented, and cost-effective.   3. Team Leadership: Build and mentor a team of data engineers, fostering an environment of continuous learning and adoption of best data engineering practices.         Job Benefits             Go-getter, with a never-say-die attitude             Ability to work on stretch goals and highly demanding targets             Self-starter with the ability to work with limited input             Excellent verbal and written communication skills             Excellent planning, organizational, and prioritization skills             Good business acumen and excellent consultative sales skills             Ability to build deep and lasting relationships with people           Contacts         Email : hr@lagozon.com         Mobile : +91 98105 15823       Position: Practice Manager Data Engineering

column2: Strategic Enterprise Account Executive will report to an Area Sales Manager or Regional Director.     Support GitLab for our strategic and large prospects within our Global Capability Centres (GCCs) customers.     Contribute to root cause analysis on wins/losses.     Communicate lessons learned to the team, including account managers, the marketing team, and the technical team.         Take ownership of your book of business     document the buying criteria     document the buying process     document next steps and owners     ensure pipeline accuracy based on evidence and not hope         Contribute to documenting improvements in our sales handbook .     Provide account leadership and direction in the pre- and post-sales process     Conduct sales activities including prospecting and developing opportunities in large/strategic accounts     Ensure the successful rollout and adoption of GitLab products through strong account management activities and coordination with pre-and-post sales engineering and support resources     Be the voice of the customer by contributing product ideas to our public issue tracker      Travel as necessary to accounts in order to develop relationships and close large opportunities     Generate qualified leads and develop new customers in conjunction with our strategic channel partners in exceeding quota.     Expand knowledge of industry as well as the competitive posture of the company     Prepare activity and forecast reports as requested     Update and maintain Sales database as appropriate     Assist sales management in conveying customer needs to product managers, and technical support staff     Utilize a consultative approach, discuss business issues with prospect and develop a formal quote, a written sales proposal or a formal sales presentation addressing their business needs.     Respond to RFPs and follow up with prospects.     Develop an account plan to sell to customers based on their business needs.     Build and strengthen the business relationship with current accounts and new prospects.     Recommend marketing strategies.     Requirements      A true desire to see customers benefit from the investment they make with you     Able to provide high degree of major account management and control     Work under minimal supervision on complex projects     Proven success with B2B software sales     Experience selling into large organizations     Interest in GitLab, and open source software     Ability to leverage established relationships and proven sales techniques for success     Effective communicator (written/verbal), strong interpersonal skills     Motivated, driven and results oriented     Excellent negotiation, presentation and closing skills     Preferred experience with Git, Software Development Tools, Application Lifecycle Management     You share our values , and work in accordance with those values.     Ability to use GitLab     Ability to travel if needed and comply with the company s travel policy

column2: We are looking for a Program Manager with technical expertise and experience in the successful delivery of services in complex and challenging environments.              We are looking for a Program manager with deep technical expertise and experience in the successful delivery of services in complex and challenging environments.                  What do we offer:                 An environment that fosters continuous learning of new skills and technologies.             Be part of one of the fastest-growing businesses as we continue to release new capabilities for Dynamics 365.             Opportunity to work alongside the engineering team responsible for the design, development and release of Dynamics 365.             Opportunity to help shape the future product direction             Surround yourself with people who are passionate about cloud computing and believe that extraordinary support is critical to customer success                       Deep understanding and demonstrated hands-on experience of implementation, troubleshooting and supporting one or more of the Dynamics 365 products (Finance/SCM/Commers/Platform) is a must Dynamics Finance & operations (D365 F&O).          Passion for customers and focus on delivering the right customer experience.         The understanding of cloud computing technologies is highly desired - Azure Core Platform; Data Platform: SQL, Azure DB; Application development experience; Power BI, PowerApps          Ability to learn new technology in a fast-paced environment.          Desired B.S./B.A. Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Equivalent Experience.          7+ years in a technical position with exposure to customer side troubleshooting                  Preferred/Additional Qualifications (Optional, at HM discretion)             Experience implementing (functional or technical) and supporting Dynamics 365 or competitive solutions.          Technical proficiency in adjacent technologies including one or more of the following: Office 365, Power BI, PowerApps, Microsoft Azure, Azure Logic Apps, Flow, SQL, SSRS, AAD, etc (certifications a plus).         Demonstrated skills and abilities to consistently create an engaging experience for our customers and Partners.          Program or Engineering management experience implementing cloud technologies.         Travel: Occasional travel is expected in this role.                     Tasks   ?                           Collaborates with appropriate customer stakeholders & directly manage the long-term support relationship with Dynamics 365 customers          Take your deep technical and Dynamics 365 product expertise and combine it with your understanding of our customer s needs to solve their complex business challenges and resolve critical and complex technical issues in a 24x7x365 global support delivery team.          Relentlessly champion and advocate for our customers in representing their issues to engineering teams and be a change agent to develop innovative ways to resolve their issues. Being encouraged by the team around you to go above and beyond to delight the customer.          Work on critical, highly complex customer scenarios that span across multiple services and also be able to quickly identify customer issues and conduct in-depth diagnostics          Proactively seeks new knowledge and adapts to new trends, technical solutions, and patterns that will improve the availability, reliability, efficiency, observability, and performance of products while also driving consistency in monitoring and operations at scale.          As a member of the product engineering team you will use your engineering skills to improve our products and services, based on customer feedback and insights gained while supporting them.          Apply an engineering mindset to eliminate top issues impacting customer experience across large and strategic sets of customers.          Work with engineering teams to not only reactively support but deliver solutions and new capabilities for our customers most mission critical deployments.         Acts as a Designated Responsible Individual (DRI) as part of on-call and work along with other engineers by developing and following the playbook, working on call to monitor system/product/service for degradation, downtime, or interruptions, alerting stakeholders about status and initiates actions to restore system/product/service for simple and complex problems when appropriate.         Drives efforts to ensure the correct processes are followed to achieve a high degree of security, privacy, safety, and accessibility.          Participate in recruiting and ramping up a global support team for our top customers and involve in coach/mentor new hires.          Contribute to forums and develop self-help documentation and quick "How To" videos. Develop and present training and Help establish a real-time readiness model for the team by constantly updating training & readiness content as cloud technology evolves.          Act as a technical escalation point within the team          Work with leadership on process improvement and strategic initiatives.              Key business metrics:             Drive customer success and adoption          Reduce time and cost to onboard          Provide high quality data to help drive service improvement

column2: S&C GN Song Commerce & Sales Join our team of Commerce consultants who work on Digital Commerce strategy and transformation practices to accelerate business change. Practice: Global Network Song Commerce & Sales - E-Commerce  I Areas of Work:Digital Commerce | Level:Manager | Location: Bengaluru, Mumbai, Gurgaon, Chennai, Pune, Hyderabad, Kolkata |  Years of Exp: At least Minimum 8-12 years with 80% relevant experience Explore an Exciting Career at Accenture  Are you passionate about scaling businesses using in-depth Digital Commerce Strategy and execution techniques? Do you want to design, build, and implement strategies to enhance business performance? Does working in an inclusive and collaborative environment spark your interest? Then, this is the right place for you! Welcome to a host of exciting global opportunities in  Accenture S&C GN Song.  The  S&C GN Song consulting team  is aligned to the  Strategy & Consulting Global Network  division of Accenture and works with clients across its commerce, marketing, sales and services department. As part the team, you will provide transformation services across key offerings like Marketing Transformation, Commerce Transformation, Sales & Advanced Customer Engagement. These services help our clients become living businesses by optimizing their marketing and sales strategies and thereby optimizing their cost to serve, thus improving revenue per customer. You will work closely with our clients as Consulting Professionals who design, build and implement strategies that can help enhance business performance. As part of these, you will drive, lead the workstream or the consulting team in the following: Develop Functional Solutions leveraging e-commerce platform knowledge :In-depth knowledge of at least one of the market leading e-commerce platforms and strong experience across business models such as B2B, D2C, B2C, Marketplace to drive commerce transformation for our clients. Bridge the gap between business problems and technical solutions:  Ability to think through problems and make actionable recommendations through assessment and solutioning. Understanding of business language:  Ability to collaborate with client, shape the end-to-end solution, help translate the requirements and feature list into user stories which can be understood by the delivery teams. Assets, Solutions and POVs:  Ability to lead a team to build Accenture level assets and commerce solutions and industry POVs related to commerce trends. Bring your best skills forward to excel at the role: Functional hands-on experience :on digital commerce transformation programs powered by market leading commerce platforms such as SAP Commerce Cloud Salesforce Commerce cloud Adobe Commerce (Magento) and drive functional solutioning leveraging rich digital commerce expertise. Create valid business case and strategic transformation roadmap:  good understanding of market realities, benefit to business and complexities of implementation to define strategic commerce roadmap for Clients. Use creativity and innovation:  Able to work in a fast-paced environment with the ability to abstract detail into larger patterns. Senior stakeholder management -  Experience of working with senior stakeholders for alignment and buy-in of projects led by the candidate. Qualification Your experience counts! MBA preferably in Sales & Marketing At least minimum 8 12 years of total experience with minimum 8 years of digital commerce functional experience in areas of Platform Transformation, E-commerce- Strategy, GTM; Product; Commerce Operations; Growth & P&L Management; Performance Marketing (E-com & DTC), Digital Marketing & Transformation; Content Marketing; Social Commerce & Growth Hacking etc. Certified on 1 or more E-Commerce platform SAP Commerce Cloud Salesforce Commerce Cloud Adobe Commerce (Magneto) What is in it for you? An opportunity to work on

column2: We are seeking a knowledgeable and experienced SAP for Utilities Consultant specializing in Energy Data Management (EDM) and Device Management (DM) to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for implementing, configuring, and optimizing SAP solutions tailored to the unique requirements of utility companies. Your expertise in EDM and DM processes will be instrumental in helping our clients efficiently manage energy data and devices.       Key Responsibilities:         Energy Data Management (EDM):             Requirements Analysis:    Collaborate with utility clients to understand their energy data management needs and objectives, including meter data collection, validation, and aggregation.           SAP EDM Implementation:    Configure SAP EDM modules to support meter data acquisition, validation, estimation, and editing (MAVEE) processes.           Interval Data Handling:    Implement interval data handling solutions for managing high-frequency meter data, including load profiles and time-of-use data.           Data Validation:    Set up data validation rules and processes to ensure the accuracy and consistency of meter data.           Data Aggregation:    Configure data aggregation and roll-up processes for summarizing meter data across various levels of granularity.           Billing Integration:    Ensure seamless integration of EDM with billing systems to support accurate invoicing based on meter data.           Data Analysis:    Utilize SAP EDM's analytical capabilities to identify trends, anomalies, and consumption patterns within meter data.           Device Management (DM):             Device Management Requirements:    Collaborate with clients to gather and understand their device management needs, including the management of utility assets and devices such as meters, sensors, and communication devices.           SAP DM Configuration:    Configure SAP DM modules to manage device lifecycle, including device registration, installation, maintenance, and decommissioning.           Device Diagnostics:    Implement diagnostic functionalities to monitor the health and performance of utility devices, enabling predictive maintenance.           Device Integration:    Ensure seamless integration of DM with other utility systems (e.g., CIS - Customer Information System) for real-time device status updates.           Inventory Management:    Set up inventory tracking and management for utility assets, ensuring accurate records of device installations and replacements.           Device Security:    Implement security measures to protect device data and ensure compliance with data privacy regulations.           Documentation:    Prepare comprehensive technical documentation, including configuration guides and process flows.           Testing and Validation:    Conduct thorough testing of EDM and DM solutions, including unit testing, integration testing, and user acceptance testing.           Support and Training:    Provide end-user training and support, assisting with issue resolution and troubleshooting.           Continuous Improvement:    Stay updated on SAP for Utilities best practices, new features, and industry standards, and make recommendations for process improvements.           Requirements:         Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.     Minimum of 3 years of experience in SAP for Utilities implementation, specifically in Energy Data Management (EDM) and Device Management (DM).     Proficiency in configuring SAP EDM and DM modules.     Strong understanding of utility industry processes and metering technologies.     Knowledge of SAP integration techniques and familiarity with other SAP for Utilities modules.     Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.     Effective communication and interpersonal skills.     Ability to work independently and as part of a team.     SAP certification in SAP for Utilities is a plus.
column11: Computer science, Data analysis, SAP, Data management, Analytical, Billing, Integration testing, Unit testing, Troubleshooting, Technical documentation

column2: The Value Consulting team is a fast growing team of young, entrepreneurial and digital consultants that all earned their stripes at some of the best strategy firms around the globe.            We are building a transformational selling & strategic advisory arm at Backbase.We operate at the intersection of financial services and digital business transformation, where we help our customers ride the waves of digital transformation successfully.            In a consultative and collaborative approach, you drive strategic consulting engagements with our customers - top-tier to mid-size banks and credit unions - to help address their most complex business and technological challenges.            With your deep understanding of our customer s business models and your expertise in the (digital) banking domain you create a compelling long-term vision, laser-sharp financial business case and a value-driven implementation roadmap utilizing the Backbase Platform to its fullest extent.            Ultimately, by directly engaging with and presenting in front of the executive teams of our customers, you accelerate decision-making and help grow the long-term relationship with our customers successfully.            Meet the job            Engagement Management: You lead strategic customer engagements with top prospects and customers by delivering high impact sessions, workshops and (re-usable) materials and tools      You maintain a high level understanding of Backbase platform capabilities to advise and inspire teams and customers;Strategic Analysis: You take pride in a best-in-class strategic and financial analysis with top-quality deliverables      You apply business design, management consulting and financial analysis best-practices and tools in a pragmatic approach      You have a broad strategic mind and you thrive in a broad spectrum of both digital, financial as well as organizational challenges      You combine empathy, creative instinct and business savvy to challenge the assumptions our customers have made about the best ways to extract value from their ecosystems;Market Research & Insights: You are always up-to-date with the latest financial services and digital banking market trends and insights      You contribute to thought leadership in Backbase through sharing your findings actively;Consulting Tools, Content & Frameworks: You work smart by creating and maintaining Backbase-specific tools, content, frameworks and best-practices to help any customer-facing function in Backbase to make an impact (egSales / Solutions Engineering / Customer Success)              How about you          You have 5+ years of work experience as a (digital) strategy consultant for one or more of the best strategy consultant firms or digital boutique consultancy firms around the globe. Banking, payments, tech or SaaS experience is a plus.      However, a can-do mentality is of more importance than many years of the perfect experience;        You are street smart and digital savvy. A true team player with a sense of humor, hands-on and self-motivated, able to drive progress and hit deadlines;        You are a well-rounded and experienced consultant with superior analytical, quantitative and conceptual thinking skills;        You have significant experience with customer-centric methods such as lean start-up, design thinking, value proposition design and agile transformation.      You know the tools and best-practices that are common in the market. Next to that, your financial analysis / ROI assessment and business case building skills are second to none;        You have significant experience in designing and optimizing banking processes and customer journeys following lean six sigma principles.        You know like nobody else what the bar is for a great and impactful consulting outcome and respective deliverables. You are passionate about creating the most impactful analyses, business cases and high-quality pitches;        You have strong interpersonal and communication skills that will ensure successful customer engagements and collaboration across multiple teams, cultures and timezones;        You have excellent English speaking, writing and presentation skills, as well as a strong ability to persuade, inspire and motivate others. column2: Geeta Shipping & Clearing Services (Geeta Group) is looking for Consultant Advisor Freight Forwarding to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      A Freight Forwarding Specialist plays a crucial role in the transportation and logistics industry, ensuring the smooth movement of goods from one location to another, both domestically and internationally      The primary responsibilities of this role include coordinating shipments, managing documentation, and liaising with various stakeholders to ensure timely and efficient delivery of goods        Key Responsibilities:        Shipment Coordination: Coordinate the transportation of goods by air, sea, road, or rail, depending on the requirements of the shipment and the most cost-effective and efficient means of transportation      Documentation Management: Prepare and manage shipping documentation, including bills of lading, export/import documentation, customs clearance forms, and other required paperwork to ensure compliance with regulations and smooth passage through customs      Carrier Negotiation: Negotiate freight rates and contracts with carriers, freight forwarders, and other service providers to secure the best possible terms and pricing for shipments      Customer Service: Serve as the main point of contact for customers, providing updates on shipment status, addressing inquiries and concerns, and ensuring a high level of customer satisfaction throughout the shipping process      Supply Chain Optimization: Work closely with other departments, such as procurement, warehousing, and distribution, to optimize supply chain operations and streamline the movement of goods from suppliers to customers      Risk Management: Identify and mitigate potential risks and disruptions in the transportation process, such as delays, damages, or regulatory issues, by implementing appropriate contingency plans and monitoring shipment progress closely      Compliance: Stay up-to-date with international trade regulations, customs procedures, and shipping requirements to ensure full compliance and minimize the risk of penalties or delays

This role requires a deep understanding of hardware and software interactions,  system architecture,  and power management techniques. Performance Optimization:        Lead initiatives to enhance system performance while maintaining or improving power efficiency. Cross-Functional Collaboration:        Work closely with hardware,  software,  and system architecture teams to ensure power and performance goals are aligned. Testing and Validation:        Define and execute power and performance test plans.         Use industry-standard tools and methodologies to validate power and performance metrics.         Ensure products meet regulatory and compliance standards related to power consumption.                 Research and Development:        Stay updated with the latest trends and technologies in power management and performance optimization. Documentation and Reporting:        Document power management and performance optimization processes and methodologies. Experience:        Minimum of 8 years of experience in power management and performance optimization.         Proven track record of leading power and performance initiatives in hardware and software environments.                 Technical Skills:        In-depth knowledge of power management techniques and performance optimization methodologies.         Proficiency with tools and technologies for power and performance analysis (e. g. ,  power analyzers,  performance profilers).         Strong understanding of system architecture,  hardware design,  and software development.                 Soft Skills:        Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.         Strong communication and collaboration skills.         Ability to lead and manage cross-functional teams.                             Preferred Qualifications            Experience in the consumer electronics or semiconductor industry with 15+yrs of exp        Familiarity with machine learning and AI-driven power management techniques.         Understanding of regulatory standards and compliance related to power consumption.                         Location:             Bangalore,  India
